intro: Calopyxis eriantha var. longicolla, commonly known as the long-stemmed calopyxis, is a rare and distinctive member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces unique, bell-shaped flowers that are often white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, making it a sought-after species for tropical and subtropical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
